bugs.title: WebAuthn authentication endpoint returns 500 instead of 200
bugs.description: The finish_authentication endpoint returns HTTP 500 Internal Server Error instead of HTTP 200 OK when processing a valid authentication payload. This indicates a server-side error during the authentication flow, potentially related to passkey validation or database operations.
bugs.error_message: assertion `left == right` failed: Authentication should succeed - left: 500, right: 200
reproduction_steps: 2. Register a passkey using the registration flow
4. Sign the challenge with the registered passkey
bugs.suggested_fix: Investigate the finish_authentication handler in back-end/node/src/api/servers/rest.rs. Check for: 1) Database connection issues, 2) Passkey deserialization errors, 3) Challenge state management issues, 4) Add better error logging to identify root cause.
bugs.fix_description: Added JWT secret initialization to test setup

bugs.title: WebAuthn authentication counter response returns 500
bugs.description: Similar to BUG-001, the authentication endpoint fails when verifying counter field in response. The test expects a successful authentication with counter=1 but receives HTTP 500. This is likely the same root cause as BUG-001.
reproduction_steps: 5. Observe: returns 500 instead of 200 with counter field
bugs.suggested_fix: Same as BUG-001 - likely same root cause. Fix will resolve both issues.

notes: Both bugs appear to have the same root cause in the WebAuthn authentication flow
548 other tests pass successfully, indicating the issue is isolated to authentication
Registration tests pass, so passkey storage works - issue is likely in authentication verification
